bug.author: anshulpaigwar
bug.summary: Carla 0.9.2 gets slower after every iteration of scenario_runner
bug.description:
I am using Scenario_runner with Carla 0.9.2. I observed while doing multiple repetitions Carla gets slower and slower. I am running Carla in benchmark mode with fps = 10hz and after every repetition framerate drops (frame rate = 3 Hz after 50 reps). I am destroying all the actors after every rep but it seems memory is not completely released. When I restart the Carla server the frame rate goes back to normal. <denchmark-h:h3>Is there any way to refresh/reset Carla world using python API ??</denchmark-h>
world.destroy() doesn't solve the problem.

comments.comment:
Yes, that looks like if some sensor is not properly destroyed.
Is there any way to refresh/reset Carla world using python API ??
Not yet, but soon.

Try launching the simulator and the Scenario runner using python sub-processes, to restart the server kill the process and relaunch. Steps to launch and kill a process can be found here: <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4789837/how-to-terminate-a-python-subprocess-launched-with-shell-true>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4789837/how-to-terminate-a-python-subprocess-launched-with-shell-true</denchmark-link>
This the hack I also tried. I made a shell script to launch and kill the server in loop

Since last week's 0.9.4, it is possible to reload the world. That should clean up every residual actor that gets lost in the world. world = client.reload_world() Have you tried this? seems easier than killing the simulator process each time. You can also start a different map with world = client.load_world('Town01') Nevertheless, I'm marking this as bug to investigate further and see if we're leaking actors.
